newsitem.title: USA: C-Phone gets initial TV video phone order.
newsitem.headline: C-Phone gets initial TV video phone order.

text.p: C-Phone Corp said Friday it had received an initial purchase order from retailer Nobody Beats The Wiz for its TV-based video phone.
The Wiz will introduce "C-Phone Home" for Mother's Day at each of its consumer electronic retail outlets, C-Phone said. Shipments to the stores will begin before the end of March.
The company's shares were up 2-1/4 to nine in late morning trading on Nasdaq.
C-Phone Home is a self-contained television set-top box operated by a wireless remote control and microphone. With the TV on, customers can speed dial or answer a video call using the remote control.
C-Phone said the product has a suggested retail price of $349.95 when purchased with a separate video network service contract, which ranges from about $8.95 to $19.95 per month.
The product is also available without a monthly video service contract for a suggested retail price of $995.00, the company said.
